After a day full of stressful meetings and a strenuous workout session at the gym, John could barely keep his eyes open, and this exhaustion led him to mistakenly assess his neighbor's friendly gesture of checking if he was alright as an intrusive attempt to pry into his personal life.

After a gruelling 12-hour long flight, Amelia, who's usually patient and understanding, grows irritated at the slightest inconvenience at the airport, inaccurately blaming the staff for inefficient services, exhibiting her cognitive bias influenced by her temporary state of extreme exhaustion.

After a long, sleepless night studying for her exams, Mary began to believe she would fail all her subjects, despite having been a straight-A student throughout the year. This error in judgement was influenced by her exhaustion.

John was usually a calm and patient individual, but after his string of 24-hour shifts and sleep deprivation, he found himself easily irritated and prone to snap at even the easiest of questions — a clear display of his exhaustion affecting his judgment.

After getting only a couple hours of sleep due to an intense week of work, Samantha decided to quit her job because she labeled it impossible to juggle, embodying the hot-cold empathy gap bias. This describes her inability to perceive her job rationally, as her present exhausted state amplified her decision-making process.

After a strenuous all-nighter for an impending project deadline, John's hunger pangs finally got the better of him. Despite usually avoiding fast food due to its unhealthy nature, he found himself craving a greasy cheeseburger and fries. His judgement on healthy eating was clearly affected by his current physical state of extreme fatigue and hunger.

After a grueling 12-hour shift at the ER, Sarah, usually a cautious motorist, aggressively sped through several yellow lights on her way home."  In this sentence, Sarah exhibits a change in judgment most likely due to a temporary state of physical exhaustion due to her long work shift, hence her uncharacteristic aggressive driving.

However, due to his fatigue, he immediately felt frustrated, assuming it was another tedious task dumped on his desk, showing the impact of his current state bias.

After running an entire marathon, James was exceptionally exhausted and dehydrated. Normally adept at making strategic decisions for his company, he hastily agreed to a risky business proposal that he usually would have meticulously analyzed and probably rejected. This example displays the affect heuristic bias, where his current physical state negatively influenced his decision-making capacity.

Ever since Robert's marathon, he felt invincible and that led him to overestimate his ability to finish a very challenging business project single-handedly in a short period of time; this shows an example of affect heuristic, where his temporary physical state influenced his judgment and decision-making abilities.
After pulling an all-nighter for his projects, John was so exhausted that he inadvertently ordered a large black coffee instead of his usual cappuccino.
